abstract: Kurdish officials report that Islamic State has attacked Kurds in Iraq and Syria with rudimentary chemical weapons, account confirmed by Western ordnance disposal technician; while not without precedent, group's ability to manufacture such weapons could be sign of expansion of group's capabilities.
lead_paragraph: The development, which investigators said involved toxic industrial or agricultural chemicals, signaled a potential escalation of the group’s capabilities.

headline.main: ISIS Has Fired Chemical Mortar Shells, Evidence Indicates
headline.print_headline: ISIS Is Accused of Using Chemical Weapons Against Kurds in Iraq and Syria

snippet: The development, which investigators said involved toxic industrial or agricultural chemicals, signaled a potential escalation of the group’s capabilities.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
